articles.author: Jason Horowitz
articles.title: A Sicilian Town Sends an Omen of a Much Hotter Future - The New York Times
articles.description: Floridia may have hit 124 degrees Fahrenheit this week, possibly the highest temperature ever recorded in Europe, offering Italy and the entire Mediterranean a preview of things to come.
articles.content: The intense heat essentially stopped the snails in their tracks, as their feet burned on the ground. They stop, and they die, she said. Others sought shade under terra-cotta roof shingles she put in … [+1075 chars]

articles.title: Turkey flood deaths rise as fresh fires erupt on Greek island of Evia - The Guardian
articles.description: Twenty-seven killed in Turkish flash flooding, with southern Europe bracing for more extreme weather

articles.author: Zaina Alibhai
articles.title: ‘Lucifer’ heat dome is causing wildfires and record-breaking temperatures in Europe - The Independent
articles.description: The hot, dry weather has been brought on by a weather phenomenon known as an anticyclone
articles.content:
An anticyclone named Lucifer sweeping across Europe is set to bring further record-breaking temperatures and wildfires.
Countries in the south of the continent have been battling blazes for some wee… [+2099 chars]

articles.title: EU to propose common charger for all smartphones, ignores Apple's protest - AppleInsider
articles.description: The European Union's long-running plan to harmonize chargers for smartphones, and other devices, is reportedly set to be formally proposed and could become legislation.
